task:
Using the same kidney Xenium dataset (300-gene panel) with per-cell spatial centroids (x, y), assign each cell to one of the 20 populations in the vocabulary below, then report the overall distribution as the percentage of total cells per type. Use exact vocabulary strings (apply synonym mapping such as FR_PT → FR-PT, Inj_PT → Inj-PT, EC → non-glom EC). The percentages should sum to ~100%.

Vocabulary: Pod, Glom-EC, non-glom EC, PTS1, PTS2, PTS3, Inj-PT, FR-PT, DTL, TAL, DCT, CNT, PC, ICA, ICB, Uro, PEC, Fib, Per-SMC, Immune

Output your final answer in the following format:
<EVAL_ANSWER>
{
  "total_cells": <number>,
  "cell_type_distribution": {
    "TAL": <percentage>,
    "Fib": <percentage>,
    "Inj-PT": <percentage>,
    "PTS2": <percentage>,
    "non-glom EC": <percentage>,
    "PTS1": <percentage>,
    "PTS3": <percentage>,
    "Immune": <percentage>,
    "Per-SMC": <percentage>,
    "DCT": <percentage>,
    "CNT": <percentage>,
    "PC": <percentage>,
    "Glom-EC": <percentage>,
    "ICB": <percentage>,
    "DTL": <percentage>,
    "FR-PT": <percentage>,
    "Pod": <percentage>,
    "ICA": <percentage>,
    "Uro": <percentage>,
    "PEC": <percentage>
  }
}
</EVAL_ANSWER>

cell_type_percentages.description: Each cell type percentage must be within ±3% of ground truth
